title: Create DBI connector — connect_dbi
text: new connector_dbi object

title: Create DBI connector — connect_dbi
text: extra_class parameter allows create subclass connector_dbi object. can useful want create custom connection object easier dispatch new s3 methods, still inheriting methods connector_dbi object.

title: Create DBI connector — connect_dbi
code: # Connect to in memory SQLite database  db <- connect_dbi(RSQLite::SQLite(), ":memory:")  db #> <connector_dbi> #>   Public: #>     disconnect: function ()  #>     get_conn: function ()  #>     initialize: function (drv, ...)  #>     list_content: function (...)  #>     read: function (name, ...)  #>     tbl: function (name, ...)  #>     write: function (x, name, ...)  #>   Private: #>     conn: SQLiteConnection #>     finalize: function ()   # Create subclass connection  db_subclass <- connect_dbi(RSQLite::SQLite(), ":memory:", extra_class = "subclass")  db_subclass #> <connector_dbi_subclass> #>   Inherits from: <R6_subclass> #>   Public: #>     disconnect: function ()  #>     get_conn: function ()  #>     initialize: function (drv, ...)  #>     list_content: function (...)  #>     read: function (name, ...)  #>     tbl: function (name, ...)  #>     write: function (x, name, ...)  #>   Private: #>     conn: SQLiteConnection #>     finalize: function ()  class(db_subclass) #> [1] "connector_dbi_subclass" "R6_subclass"            "connector_dbi"          #> [4] "R6"

title: DBI connector — connector_dbi
code: # Create DBI connector  db <- connector::connector_dbi$new(RSQLite::SQLite(), ":memory:")  db #> <connector_dbi> #>   Public: #>     disconnect: function ()  #>     get_conn: function ()  #>     initialize: function (drv, ...)  #>     list_content: function (...)  #>     read: function (name, ...)  #>     tbl: function (name, ...)  #>     write: function (x, name, ...)  #>   Private: #>     conn: SQLiteConnection #>     finalize: function ()   # Write to the database  db$write(iris, "iris")  # Read from the database  db$read("iris") |>   head(5) #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa #> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa #> 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa  # List available tables  db$list_content() #> [1] "iris"  # Use the connector to run a query  db$get_conn() |>   DBI::dbGetQuery("SELECT * FROM iris limit 5") #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa #> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa #> 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa  # Use dplyr verbs and collect data  db$tbl("iris") |>   dplyr::filter(Sepal.Length > 7) |>   dplyr::collect() #> # A tibble: 12 × 5 #>    Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species   #>           <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>     #>  1          7.1         3            5.9         2.1 virginica #>  2          7.6         3            6.6         2.1 virginica #>  3          7.3         2.9          6.3         1.8 virginica #>  4          7.2         3.6          6.1         2.5 virginica #>  5          7.7         3.8          6.7         2.2 virginica #>  6          7.7         2.6          6.9         2.3 virginica #>  7          7.7         2.8          6.7         2   virginica #>  8          7.2         3.2          6           1.8 virginica #>  9          7.2         3            5.8         1.6 virginica #> 10          7.4         2.8          6.1         1.9 virginica #> 11          7.9         3.8          6.4         2   virginica #> 12          7.7         3            6.1         2.3 virginica  # Disconnect from the database  db$disconnect()

title: Read a file based on this extension — read_ext
code: temp_csv <- tempfile("iris", fileext = ".csv") write.csv(iris, temp_csv, row.names = FALSE) class(temp_csv) <- "csv" read_ext(temp_csv) #> Rows: 150 Columns: 5 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> chr (1): Species #> dbl (4): Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, Petal.Length, Petal.Width #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. #> # A tibble: 150 × 5 #>    Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #>           <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>   #>  1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2 setosa  #>  2          4.9         3            1.4         0.2 setosa  #>  3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2 setosa  #>  4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2 setosa  #>  5          5           3.6          1.4         0.2 setosa  #>  6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4 setosa  #>  7          4.6         3.4          1.4         0.3 setosa  #>  8          5           3.4          1.5         0.2 setosa  #>  9          4.4         2.9          1.4         0.2 setosa  #> 10          4.9         3.1          1.5         0.1 setosa  #> # ℹ 140 more rows

code: temp_csv <- tempfile("iris", fileext = ".csv") write.csv(iris, temp_csv, row.names = FALSE) read_file(temp_csv) #> Rows: 150 Columns: 5 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> chr (1): Species #> dbl (4): Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, Petal.Length, Petal.Width #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. #> # A tibble: 150 × 5 #>    Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #>           <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>   #>  1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2 setosa  #>  2          4.9         3            1.4         0.2 setosa  #>  3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2 setosa  #>  4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2 setosa  #>  5          5           3.6          1.4         0.2 setosa  #>  6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4 setosa  #>  7          4.6         3.4          1.4         0.3 setosa  #>  8          5           3.4          1.5         0.2 setosa  #>  9          4.4         2.9          1.4         0.2 setosa  #> 10          4.9         3.1          1.5         0.1 setosa  #> # ℹ 140 more rows
